title: What’s the greatest moment in Japanese history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tokugawa Ieyasu, the last of Japan’s three heroes wins The battle of Sekigahara in 1600. The battle of Sekigahara, which pitted Ieyasu’s troops against the combined armies of his rivals, has rightfully been called “the most significant battle in Japanese history,” for it marked the triumph of the new social order. The battle itself began at eight o’clock in the morning on October 21 and lasted well into the afternoon, by which time the rival barons were in full retreat. Three years later, Ieyasu was to establish a new shogunate, one based not in Kyoto but in the eastern region known as the Kantō. From. Japan, a History by Lucas Peyton Thomas. I am reading the book currently.

The Post War History (since 1945) history of Japan is interesting as well inspiring. After WW II had ended with nuclear bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Japan was devastated. All the large towns, the industries and the transportation networks were in ruins. A severe shortage of food continued for several years. Japan lost the Kurile islands that were occupied by the Soviet Union, and the entire Japanese civilian population of roughly 17,000 was expelled from there by 1946. The territorial dispute with Russia concerning the Kurile Islands has not been resolved yet. The Ryukyu Islands, including Okinawa, were controlled by the US. Okinawa was returned to Japan in 1972. The remains of Japan's war machine were destroyed, and war crime trials were held. Over 500 military officers committed suicide right after Japan surrendered, and many hundreds more were executed for committing war crimes. A new constitution went into effect in 1947. Japan was also forbidden to ever lead a war again or to maintain an army. However, in 1952, the occupation ended. Japan's military was established in 1954. After the Korean War in 1950 and accelerated by it, Japan's economy recovered and flourished. The economic growth resulted in a quick rise of the living standards, changes in society and the stabilization of the political system. The US was also keen to develop the economy of Japan because there was a risk after World War II that an unhappy and poor Japanese population would turn to communism. Japanese economic miracle refers to the significant increase in the Japanese economy during the time between the end of World War II and the end of the Cold War (1945–1991). Now Japan is the world's third largest automobile manufacturing country. has the largest electronics industry and is often ranked among the world's most innovative countries. It is the 3rd largest country in the world by nominal GDP, after the US and China. Industry accounts for 24% of the nation's GDP. Looking at the size of Japan and its population it is a remarkable achievement.

In 1944 on the border between France and Germany the Japanese American 442nd Regiment was tasked with establishing contact with the 36th Texas Division which had been cut off from the rest of the Army by confused determined German Fanatics. In a large act of heroism, an act of which was common place in the Pacific theater of war but where not seen in any other battles (not including Russia). as the German lines broke attack after attack and pinned down American GI’s in their foxholes. the Japanese Americans stood up from their positions, and in one mass charge they successfully broke the enemy line screaming BANZAI! in there charge. That Regiment is the Most decorated Unit in U.S. history.

The Meiji Restoration. Japan, after 300 years of isolation, were forced to modernize when ships of the US Navy entered Tokyo Bay and made demands.The Shoguns, who ruled for those 300 years lasted only 12 more years. Th Emperor, who was relegated to Kyoto, returned to Tokyo and started the modernization of Japan which characterizes the culture to this day. “Meiji” means “enlightenment”.

The first real step in Japan acknowledging the massive amounts of toxic pollution that industrialisation had brought about and the horrendous damage inflicted on the environment and the people.
